episodes.title: Ep 359 - Oscar Wrap-up - Murray Valeriano
episodes.summary: It's the first ever show recorded at the All Things Comedy Studio. Chris and Graham welcome back comedian Murray Valeriano. Murray's wife, Mary Zophres, was nominated for costume design so we get the full run down on the best picture mix up and more! It's a CFN Oscar exclusive! Better than candy falling from the sky.

episodes.title: Ep 358 - Oscar Preview - Doug Benson
episodes.summary: It is the annual Oscar Preview ep with Doug Benson. Chris, Graham and Doug discuss their picks to win awards in each category. This ep can make or break your Oscar office pool! We ay who we think should and will win!

episodes.title: Ep 357 - I Am Not Your Negro - Laura House
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: FIFTY SHADES DARKER, I AM NOT YOUR NEGRO, GHOST IN THE SHELL, PIRATES OF THE CARRIBEAN: DEAD MEN TELL NO TALES* Laura House is back talking about her new meditation podcast. Chris did not like Fifty Shades but Laura knew he wouldn't because it was not for him. Graham thinks I Am Not Your Negro is a great doc that America doesn't want to see. Ghost in the Shell keeps getting worse. Laura wants to see Javier Bardem as an ugly pirate. DVDs for every movie need and more movies to avoid while you are getting caught up on oscar films. You will need a spanking after listening to this ep.

episodes.title: Ep 356 - Hell or High Water - Nate Gowtham
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: HELL OR HIGH WATER, LIFE ANIMATED, BATMAN RETURN OF THE CAPED CRUSADERS, MISS SHARON JONES, LOGAN, GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY VOL 2* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest and documentarian Nate Gowtham. They talk about meeting at the Napa Valley Film Fest and how every party had wine. Chris finally saw Hell or High Water and loved it. Nate enjoyed Life Animated. Chris liked new Batman animated film but his kids did not. Graham wants everyone to know about Miss Sharon Jones. Nate talks about his doc, Colin Hay: Waiting for My Real Life. Three doc filmmakers talking about the process and some of the oscar nominations in the doc category. Logan and GOTG trailer look great! A couple of interesting DVDs and weirdness in theaters. This ep will make you want to start a solo career.

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 52 - 13th
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest John Opdycke. John is president of Open Primaries and talks about how 13th shows what needs to be fixed in American politics. This film and episode are very informative and helpful to understand the history of Americas problems and how to fix them.

episodes.title: Ep 355 - Resident Evil - Bert Kreischer
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: RESIDENT EVIL, REQUIEM FOR THE AMERICAN DREAM, HIDDEN FIGURES, LADY IN THE WATER, CATFIGHT, WILSON* It's another first time guest! Bert Kreischer joins Chris and Graham in the nerd cave. Bert talks about why podcasts are so great. Chris had fun at Resident Evil until he heard about the accidents. Graham enjoyed and was informed by Noam Chomsky's Requiem For The American Dream. Chris had good things to say about Hidden Figures. Bert comes out of the M. Night closet and talks about Lady In The Water. Catfight is the best trailer out right now! Some good DVDs and new releases. This ep will make you cry on a plane!

episodes.title: Ep 354 - Lion - Mary Lynn Rajskub
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: TRESSPASS AGAINST US, JACKIE, THE FOUNDER, LION, LOGAN, POWER RANGERS* Chris and Graham welcome back Mary Lynn Rajskub into Nerd central. She talks about not playing Zoe in the new 24. Chris didn't like Trespass, Mary Lynn liked Natalie Portman in Jackie but the rest fell flat. Graham and Chris split on The Founder. Graham explains how good Lion is. Oscar nominations came out. Logan trailer looks good and Power Rangers is cat nip for boys. Weird DVD assortment and don't see A Dog's Purpose. This ep will make you want to live like a British Hillbilly.

episodes.title: Ep 353 - Hidden Figures - Matt Fulchiron
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: MOONLIGHT, SILENCE, ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS, PATRIOTS DAY, HIDDEN FIGURES, CHIPS, I AM MICHEAL* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest, Matt Fulchiron into the box cave. Matt talks about The Full Charge Podcast and seeing two movies in a day. Chris liked Moonlight but had some questions. Graham and Matt were a little split on Silence. Matt got what he expected for Patriots Day. Graham got his space nerd fix in Hidden Figures. A lot of dudes being dudes in the new trailers. Go to the movies this week so you can eat fries on a motorcycle with multiple personalities as a modern woman. ONLY ONE DVD FOR YOU TO BUY THIS WEEK...EAR BUDS!

episodes.title: Ep 352 - Fences - Annabelle DiSisto
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: CAPTAIN FANTASTIC, MANCHESTER BY THE SEA, I'M NOT YOUR GURU, FENCES, RESIDENT EVIL* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest Annabelle DiSisto into the nerd HQ. They talk about the Golden Globes and Annabelle having to pay money to work at a Hooters. Chris liked Captain Fantastic. Graham and Annabelle tell Chris about Casey Affleck's horrible behavior after he says he liked Manchester by The Sea. Annabelle was inspired by the Tony Robbins doc. Graham thought Fences had great performances. Everyone is happy that Resident Evil is still going. Real tough DVD choices and fake beards and haircuts in theaters. This ep will make you want to teach finance classes in a theater!

episodes.title: Ep 351 - Passengers & Year End Thank You
episodes.summary: HAPPY HOLIDAYS! Chris and Graham talk about why Passengers failed. Then they do their year end thank you to everyone in CFN land that helps make it all happen. THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING EVERYTHING WE DO!

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 51 - Rogue One
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF MOVIE WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Mike Schmidt joins Chris and Graham in the nerd garage to discuss Rogue One and why all three loved it.

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 52 - Passengers
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham welcome fan and kickstarter backer Joe Hummel to discuss Passengers. Listen and learn why you should save your money.

episodes.title: Ep 350 - Rogue One - Samm Levine
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: ROGUE ONE, COLLATERAL BEAUTY, LA LA LAND, DUNKIRK, BLADE RUNNER 2049* Graham and Chris welcome back Samm Levine into the CFN Santa workshop. Samm and Graham bury some hatchets. Chris and Graham liked Rogue One. Samm and Graham had to do a mini spoiler about how bad Collateral Beauty was. Chris had fun at LA LA Land. Dunkirk and Blade Runner 2049 trailers look great! Samm tells a Inglorious story. Ok DVDs and a bunch of business in theaters. This ep will make you want to sit on the aisles so you don't see the answers.

episodes.title: Ep 349 - LA LA Land - Chip Chinery
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: OFFICE CHRISTMAS PARTY, LA LA LAND, TE FOUNDER, SPIDERMAN: HOMECOMING, FAST AND FURIOUS 8, WAR FOR THE PLANET OF THE APES* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest and money expert, Chip Chinery. Chris found Office Christmas Party to be a by the numbers comedy that was not great. Chip and Graham liked the throw back nature of LA LA Land. Chip's enjoyment of biopics made The Founder a good watch. Three trailers that make next summer look fun and more! I think some kind of spaceship film is coming out this weekend but not sure...

episodes.title: Ep 348 - Moana - Cecily Knobler
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: MOANA, ALLIED, SILENCE, THE MUMMY, GUARDIANS OF THE GALAXY 2* Frist time guest Cecily Knobler joins the lads in the CFN t-shirt cabana. Chris and Cecily liked Moana. Graham and Cecily both found Allied to be a C+ at best.  Silence and The Mummy look like ridiculous nonsense while GOTG 2 is going to be awesome! Only one logical DVD choice this week and three solid films in theaters! This episode is the Fastest and Mummiest of all shows!

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 50 - Doctor Strange
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALTER! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Jackie Kashian brings her extensive knowledge of all things Marvel to talk about Doctor Strange.

episodes.title: Ep 347 - Fantastic Beasts - Chris and Graham
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: ARRIVAL, FANTASTIC BEASTS, BILLY LYNN'S LONG HALFTIME WALK, BEAUTY AND THE BEAST, GHOST IN THE SHELL* Chris and Graham are locked alone in the nerd garage to talk films. Graham liked Arrival even with Chris pointing out some accent issues. Chris was glad Fantastic Beasts was made and fits into the Harry Potter world. Graham was 100% disappointed in Billy Lynn. It's a really slow week for new trailers, DVDs and in theaters. This ep is a perfect holiday compliment to your meal.

episodes.title: Ep 346 - Wrestling Films - Colt Cabana
episodes.summary: *THEMED EPISODE! WRESTLING FILMS AND PRO WRESTLERS WHO WERE IN FILMS* First time guest and pro wrestler, Colt Cabana talks about being a comedy pro wrestler and some of his favorite films. Chris shares his childhood love of pro wrestling and all three talk about their favorite wrestling films and more! Happy Thanksgiving!

episodes.title: Ep 345 - Arrival - Stefanie Wilder-Taylor
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: ARRIVAL, TROLLS, MIDDLE SCHOOL, NAPA FILM FEST MOIVES: STICKY NOTES, SWIM TEAM, LITTLE BOXES, GOOD BUSINESS* Chris and Graham welcome back Stefanie Wilder-Taylor to talk movies and the election. Chris was let down by Arrival. Stefanie and her kids were surprised by how much they liked Trolls and Middle School. Graham saw some great films at Napa Valley Film Fest last week. Sticky Notes, Little Boxes, Swim Team and Good Business are all films to look out for.

episodes.title: Ep 344 - Doctor Strange - Kevin Pollak
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: DOCTOR STRANGE, 13TH, THE LATE BLOOMER, RADIOACTIVE VETERAN* Kevin Pollak is back to talk movies with the gents. Chris and Graham both liked Doctor Strange while Kevin gives his comic film rant. Graham was moved by the prison doc 13th. Kevin talks about the film he directed, The Late Bloomer. A nice list of trailers to discuss, which is good since DVDs are lame. Good Veterans Day movie and book along with two good films coming out in theaters. Let's hope this episode isn't rigged!

episodes.title: Ep 343 - The Accountant - Cathy Ladman
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: SHIN GODZILLA, IN THE VALLEY OF VIOLENCE, THE ACCOUNTANT, SWISS ARMY MAN* Chris and Graham welcome long time comic friend and first time guest, Cathy Ladman. Cathy talks about being on a new Showtime series called, "I'm dying up here." Chris was let down by Shin Godzilla. Cathy and Chris split on The Accountant. Graham enjoyed the bizarre nature of Swiss Army Man. Cathy expected a little more than In The Valley Of Violence delivered. Some Ok DVD choices and then a Strange Doctor comes to a cinema near you! An episode that is like getting a Romanian Salt Mine for Christmas.

episodes.title: Ep 342 - Live from LA Podfest - Will Wheaton & Cecil Baldwin
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: BOO: A MADEA HALLOWEEN, ROUGE ONE, PASSENGERS, JACK REACHER, COLLATERAL BEAUTY, KIDNAP* Live from 2016 LA Podcast Festival. First time guests Wil Wheaton and Cecil Baldwin talk about a wide range of films coming out in the fall/winter. Welcome to the next generation of CFN live shows!

episodes.title: Ep 341 - Girl On The Train - Denise Gossett
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: GIRL ON THE TRAIN, HUNT FOR THE WILDERPEOPLE, BATMAN BAD BLOOD, JOHN WICK CHAPTER 2* Chris and Graham welcome Denise Gossett for her first full episode in the gargoyle garage. Graham was disappointed in Girl On The Train. Chris found Hunt for The Wilderpeople to be uniquely interesting. Animated Batman was a let down for Chris. Denise talks about the 16 years that she has been producing Shriekfest and how indie horror films are evolving with better scripts and the use of technology. A good selection of  DVDs and theatrical premiers this week. This ep will wake the dead!

episodes.title: Ep 340 - Magnificent 7 - Karen Rontowski
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: MAGNIFICENT 7, MISS PEREGRINE'S HOME FOR PECULIAR CHILDREN, JACKIE* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest, Karen Rontowski, into the t-shirt/box fort. Chris and Graham split on Magnificent 7. Chris found Miss Peregrine's to be better than the book. Karen talks about being a ghost hunter and what are the best and worst paranormal films. Then Karen does a Tarot card reading for CFN. Will they ever make it out of the garage? Listen and find out!

episodes.title: Ep 339 - Magnificent 7 - Steele Saunders
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: MAGNIFICENT 7, KICKBOXER VENGEANCE, STAR TREK III, FOR THE LOVE OF SPOK, THE PREQUELS STRIKES BACK* Chris and Graham welcome back Steele Saunders into the t-shirt labyrinth. All three talk about some of their favorite moments from 2016 LA Podfest. Chris set a low bar for Kickboxer: Vengeance and it still wasn't met. Steele had fun watching Magnificent 7. Graham watched Spok doc and ST3 to have a full Star Trek week. Steele suggests the Prequel doc to help see the other side of the Star Wars Prequels. Not great DVDs or in theaters so just buy the LA Podfest live stream.

episodes.title: Ep 338 - Snowden - Stephen Sajdak
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: SNOWDEN, CARTEL LAND, BLAIR WITCH, MISS SLOANE, FIFTY SHADES DARKER* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest Stephen Sajdak. Stephen talks about his We Hate Movies podcast and The Anaconda museum. Graham liked Snowden even with #JGL doing a weird voice. Stephen and Chris were really disappointed with Blair Witch. Cartel Land gave Graham some sobering information as a good doc can. Miss Sloane looks good and why in sweet Christmas is there a Fifty Shades sequel?  This ep tastes better than a freshly baked Romanian Molly!

episodes.title: Ep 337 - Sully - Chris Gore
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: SULLY, FOR THE LOVE OF SPOCK, STAR TREK II: THE WRATH OF KHAN, SKIPTRACE* Chris and Graham welcome back Chris Gore in the the weight bench hut. Graham and Gore really liked Sully and Clint Eastwood. Mancini found For The Love Of Spock to be a nice doc about Leonard Nimoy. Graham saw Wrath of Khan on the big screen and it started a big discussion about why the JJ Abrams Star Treks fall short. Mancini was dumbfounded by Skiptrace. Some good trailers and DVD's then cover up your webcam's cause Snowden comes to town! An episode that is best served cold!

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 49 - Morgan
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM ARE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Graham and Chris go to the movies with fan and Kickstarter backer Pam Myers. Pam wanted to pick a bad film because they are better to make fun of.  She was correct!

episodes.title: Ep 336 Morgan-Cash Levy
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: MORGAN, CARLOS, HELL OR HIGH WATER, MASCOTS, MAX STEEL* Chris and Graham welcome back Cash Levy into the CFN HQ. Cash talks about doing his podcast with TJ Miller, Cashing In With TJ Miller, at LA Podfest. Graham and Chris had fun watching a move as bad as Morgan. Graham liked Carlos but found it a little long. Mascots and Max Steel don't look great and neither do some new DVDs. Sully lands (get it?) in theaters and more! This episode will make you want to sneak into the Super Bowl.

episodes.title: Ep 335 Bad Moms - Shawn Marek
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: THE SEA OF TREES, BAD MOMS, HANDS OF STONE, THE HOLLARS, KILLING JOKE* Chris and Graham welcome back former CFN intern Shawn Marek. Chris found The Sea Of Trees to be ok until the dumb ending. Graham had some laugh out loud moments during Bad Moms. Shawn found The Hollars to be adequate. Graham was pleasantly surprised by Hands of Stone. One silly horror film trailer then Shawn talks about the LA Podfest preview night at the Hollywood Improv September 22 and more! This ep will make you walk the desert without shoes looking for comic books.

episodes.title: Ep 334 - Kubo and the Two Strings - Julia Prescott
episodes.summary: *MOVIES DISCUSSED: WAR DOGS, KUBO AND THE TWO STRINGS, SAUSAGE PARTY, ARRIVAL, BAD SANTA 2* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest Julia Prescott.  Julia talks about her Everything's Coming Up Podcast, about the Simpsons and being in LA Podfest. Julia then talks about the by-the-numbers disappointment of War Dogs. Graham and Chris really liked Kubo which reminded Julia that she didn't like Sausage Party. Everyone is excited about the Arrival trailer and more! If family members are trying to take your eyes, then this ep might help.

episodes.title: Ep 333 - Pete's Dragon - Samuel Prime
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: PETE'S DRAGON, HELL OR HIGH WATER, THE SHALLOWS, CAFE SOCIETY, NERVE, ROGUE ONE, DUNKIRK* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest Samuel Prime into the nerd garage. Samuel talks about doing film restoration and the detective work involved. Chris found Pete's Dragon to be a by-the-numbers kids film. Graham liked Hell or High Water. Samuel thought The Shallows was good summer fun. Cafe Society was just ok for Chris. Samuel enjoyed Nerve even with a weird audience demographic when he saw it. Two really good trailers came out with Rogue One and Dunkirk, which is good since new DVDs are useless. Bizarre lineup getting released in theaters this week. This episode is like playing a video game while being chased by a shark.

episodes.title: Ep 332 - Suicide Squad - Jackie Kashian
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: JASON BOURNE, SUICIDE SQUAD, GHOSTBUSTERS, THE GREAT WALL, OFFICE CHRISTMAS PARTY* Chris and Graham are lucky Jackie Kashian lives close! Graham found Jason Bourne to be a serviceable food movie. Chris thought Suicide  Squad was a mess and Jackie brought some DC comics that would make a better movie. Graham found Ghostbusters to be funny and didn't understand why people got mad. Bad DVDs and many options to see rather than Suicide Squad. This ep is Lord of The Bourne!

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 48 - Star Trek Beyond
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham discuss why they liked Beyond as an action film but not as a Star Trek film. Enjoy.

episodes.title: Ep 331 - Star Trek Beyond - Juan Manuel Rocha
episodes.summary: *FILMS DUSCUSSED: STAR TREK BEYOND, KONG, JUSTICE LEAGUE, WONDER WOMAN, DR. STRANGE, BLAIR WITCH* Chris and Graham welcome back from the Comics on Comics podcast, Juan Manuel Rocha. Chris and Graham thought Star Trek was a good action film but not great Star Trek. Then all three talk about San Diego Comic Con and how fun it is. Also a long list of new trailers have been released at the con that vary from cool to dumb. A nice point of order and more! This episode will make you want to join a bowling league run by nerds.

episodes.title: Ep 330 - Ghostbusters - Betsy Kalin
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: GHOSTBUSTERS, SECRET LIFE OF PETS, PURGE, EAST LA INTERCHANGE* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest and doc filmmaker Betsy Kalin. Betsy met the guys at SF Doc Fest and talks about a cool surfer doc she saw there. Chris saw Ghostbusters and liked it but didn't feel the same about Secret Life of Pets. Graham likes the social commentary of Purge: Election Year even if it's brutal. Betsy talks about her doc on Boyle Heights, East LA Interchange and the 10 years it took to make it. Also Betsy talks about Summertime a French film she watched at Out Fest LA. This ep is like a baguette and celery.

episodes.title: Ep 329 - Independence Day - Tom Merritt
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: INDEPENDENCE DAY, GHOSTBUSTERS, THE BFG, JACK REACHER* Chris and Graham welcome back Tom Merritt. Chris and Graham didn't realize that Independence Day could be worse than their low expectations. Tom liked Ghostbusters and felt the trailers are misleading. Chris was disappointed by The BFG, but his kids liked it. Graham is the only one pumped for the new Jack Reacher film and is Never Going Back!! DVDs that can clean clothes and more! This ep is like a cuff link country club.

episodes.title: Ep 328 - TCM Film Fest - Neil T Weakley
episodes.summary: Chris and Graham talk to CFN Writer Neil T. Weakley about the Turner Classic Movies annual film festival. An amazing line-up of films with Q and A's with some of Hollywood's royalty. Fall in love with films all over again or see them for the first time on the big screen. Be ready for your close-up!

episodes.title: Ep 327 - Fantasy Films - Stephen Kramer Glickman
episodes.summary: A special themed episode talking about Fantasy Films from the 1980's and 90's. Chris and Graham welcome back Stephen Kramer Glickman to nerd out about the films of their youth and what makes them great. This ep will make you want to ride a giant flying dog.

episodes.title: Ep 326 - Finding Dory - Wayne Federman
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: FINDING DORY, SURFWISE, DE PALMA, WEINER, OJ MADE IN AMERICA*  Chris and Graham welcome back Wayne Federman. Chris liked Finding Dory on father's day. Graham was intrigued by the doc Surfwise. Wayne has been on a doc tear and saw three good films: De Palma, OJ:Made in America and Weiner. Weird looking trailers with one DVD stand-out. Independence Day: Resurgence is in theaters with sharks and a white guy helping to free slaves, so choose wisely. This ep will make you want to unpack your life.

episodes.title: Ep 325 - Now You See Me 2 - Jensen Karp
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: NOW YOU SEE ME 2, TEENAGE MUTANT NINJA TURTLES, TICKLED* Chris and Graham welcome another first time guest! Former rapper and current podcaster Jensen Karp tells the guys about his new book and more. Graham was bored and annoyed by Now You See Me 2. Chris found the new TMNT film to be slightly better than the last. Jensen loves the new doc, Tickled. All three are not sure about Tarzan trailer. Some good DVDs and one interesting doc in theaters. This ep will make you want to get your money back from Kanye West.

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 47 - Pop Star - Kickstarter Fan Diana Rojek
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT!! KEY ELEMENTS WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham go to the movies with fan/kickstarter backer, Diana Rojek. All three really liked the film and talk about how many fun surprises it had. This ep will make you want a dick in a box.

episodes.title: Ep 324 - Pop Star - Mike Schmidt
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: POP STAR, SF DOC FEST SHORT FILMS, EL CHIVO, FUTURE OF WORK AND DEATH, DWARVENAUT* Chris and Graham record from a hotel in the Bay Area with Mike Schmidt. Chris and Graham liked Pop Star more than they thought they would. Chris saw some cool short documentaries. Mike and Graham were really drawn in by the running doc, El Chivo. Chris and Graham found Future of Work and Death to get a little repetitive. Mike didn't like Dwarenaut as much as Chris and Graham did. It was a good talk about some interesting docs at the SF Doc Fest. This ep will make you want to run up a hill with a tire sandal.

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 46 - X-Men: Apocalypse
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham talk about what they liked and didn't like about the newest X-Men film.

episodes.title: Ep 323 - X-Men: Apocalypse - Jamie Flam
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: X-MEN:APOCALYPSE, NICE GUYS, SUGUAR-COATED, ANGRY BIRDS* First time guest, Jamie Flam joins our nerds in the CFN World HQ. Jamie talks about being the artistic director of the Hollywood Improv and podcasting. Chris and Graham found X-Men to be just OK.  Jamie thought Nice Guys was a little to hollywood-ish. Sugar-Coated gave Jamie something to think about. Chris was bored by Angry Birds. SpareMin with Stephen Kramer Glickman. DVDs for dullards and not much in theaters. This ep will make you want to hire a staff to run your mega-corp.

episodes.title: Ep 322 - The Nice Guys - Jay Larson
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: THE NICE GUYS, WHERE TO INVADE NEXT, THE INVITATION, GHOSTBUSTERS* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest Jay Larson to talk about his podcast, Crabfeast and more. Graham was just so-so about The Nice Guys. Chris thought Michael Moore's new film, Where to Invade Next, had some good insight but not his best film. Jay talks about how great the experience was of acting on the film, The Invitation. All three talk about how silly the Ghostbusters controversy is. Bad DVDs and then X-Men! This ep will make you want to go to jail!

episodes.title: Ep 321 - Money Monster - Tim Bennett
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: MONEY MONSTER, SUNSHINE SUPERMAN, HIGH RISE, TEMPS* Chris and Graham welcome back Tim Bennett to discuss vegan moonshine and his new film, Temps. Graham was bored with Money Monster. Chris was disappointed with High Rise. Tim loved the BASE Jumping Doc, Sunshine Superman. Interesting trailers. So-so DVDs and some great reasons to see Civil War again. Now GET OFF MY LAWN!

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 45 Captain America Civil War
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Jackie Kashian is back to talk about why she loved this film and all things Marvel. Chris and Graham also loved Civil War and all the great acting scenes amidst amazing action.

episodes.title: Ep 320 - Captain America - Josh Wolf
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: CAPTAIN AMERICA CIVIL WAR, INFERNO, INDEPENDENCE DAY, POINT BREAK* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest Josh Wolf. All three thought Civil War was awesome. Josh was amazed by the CG in both Civil War and Jungle Book. Graham saw the new Point Break on a plane and now wants to buy a GoPro. Chris saw a DVD of Kurosawa's Stray Dog from 1949. A couple more good DVDs and a big question mark about new Clooney film in theaters. Or jut see Civil War again.

episodes.title: Ep 319 - Keanu - Stephen Kramer Glickman
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: KEANU, JUNGLE BOOK, MOTHERS DAY, BATMAN THE KILLING JOKE, SNOWDEN* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest Stephen Kramer Glickman in to the Nerd HQ. Chris liked Keanu. Graham and Stephen enjoyed Jungle Book even with some CG issues. Stephen explains why he loves watching horrible films like Mother's Day. Batman and Snowden trailers look interesting. Hilarious kickstarter comments, bad DVDs but who cares because  this weekend we will all have a CIVIL WAR!!! This ep is the best reason to get relationship advice from a birthday clown.

episodes.title: Ep 318 - Indie Films - Aisha Tyler
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: VERONICA MARS, EAR BUDS, AXIS, BATMAN V SUPERMAN* Aisha Tyler comes into the nerd garage to talk about how kickstarter has helped movie fans and filmmakers like Spike Lee and Zach Braff. How she came to direct a feature film and how Veronica Mars wouldn't have a feature film without crowdfunding. Aisha also defends Batman v Superman! Do Graham and Chris throw Dana Gould shirts at her or does she convince them it wasn't that bad! Listen and find out!

episodes.title: Ep 317 - Jungle Book - Geoff Tate
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: THE JUNGLE BOOK, CRIMINAL, DEMOLITION, MAGNIFICENT SEVEN, X-MEN APOCALYPSE* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest Geoff Tate into the weight bench shed. Chris was surprised by The Jungle Book. Geoff had fun watching Criminal. Graham was glad he saw Demolition. Geoff is more excited by Magnificent Seven trailer than Chris and Graham. All three are unsure about new X-Men trailer. Odd choices on DVD. Some hilarious posts on Chris' Kickstarter and a funny movie about a cat in theaters. This episode is all about nuance.

episodes.title: Ep 316 - Everybody Wants Some - David Huntsberger
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: EVERYBODY WANTS SOME, MILES AHEAD, GENERATION IRON* Chris and Graham welcome back CFN writer David Huntsberger. David talks about his new podcast Space Cave. Chris likes Linklater films but Everybody Wants Some had a few good moments but fell a little short. Graham loved Don Cheadle's Miles Davis biopic, Miles Ahead. David was drawn into the body building doc Generation Iron. NEW SEGMENT: Talking Trailers like Rogue One and Dr. Strange. One good DVD and some question marks in theaters. This ep will make you want to coach a baseball team as a fish.

episodes.title: Ep 315 - Midnight Special - CJ Johnson
episodes.summary: *FILMS DUSCUSSED: MIDNIGHT SPECIAL, THE INVITATION, MR. RIGHT* Chris and Graham welcome back CFN writer CJ Johnson. Graham really liked Midnight Special. Chris and CJ thoroughly enjoyed the indie thriller, The Invitation. CJ talks about a cool movie book by Illiana Douglas called, I Blame Dennis Hopper. CJ also found MR. Right to be good fun, although not perfect. Good Justice League DVD and dealers choice in theaters. Put this ep in a field and wait for the FBI.

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 44 - Batman vs Superman
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham try to find some good out of the unholy mess that is Dawn Of Justice. Were they even remotely successful? Listen and find out!

episodes.title: Ep 314 - Eye In The Sky - Dave Waite
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: TRIPLE 9, EYE IN THE SKY, SYNCHRONICITY* Chris and Graham Welcome first time guest Dave Waite. Dave talks about running a comedian bro hostel and why he liked Triple 9. Chris loved the time travel film Synchronicity. Graham was happy with how the drone debate was handled in Eye In The Sky. This is a good episode for smaller films. I hope it makes you smile.

episodes.title: Ep 313 - Batman v Superman - Jay Lender & Micah Wright
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: BATMAN V SUPERMAN, THEY'RE WATCHING* Chris and Graham welcome first time guests, Jay Lender and Micah Wright. All four talk about why BvS was a complete disaster. Jay and Micah talk about their new horror comedy They're Watching. Solid DVDs this week and two out of four films look good in theaters. A perfect episode to calm your nerd rage or have a pointless dream sequence.

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 43 Whiskey Tango Foxtrot - Tiffany Haddish
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham welcome comedian Tiffany Haddish into the Nerd Garage. Tiffany talks about how she was cast in The Carmichael's and her new perfume! Graham and Tiffany liked the film but Chris was on the fence. Will Tiffany and Graham push him off it?  Listen and find out!!

episodes.title: Ep 312 - Pee-Wee's Big Holiday - Ngaio Bealum
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: PEE-WEE'S BIG ADVENTURE, BROTHERS GRIMSBY, THE SHEIK, THE WITCH* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest, Ngaio Bealum. Chris liked Pee-Wee's new film. Ngaio had fun at Brothers Grimsby. Graham really liked the documentary about pro wrestler The Sheik. Ngaio was scared at The Witch and loved Deadpool. Ok DVDs and two very different films in theaters. This film will give you reason to smoke weed for PTSD and fight a guy from another planet.

episodes.title: Ep 311 - 10 Cloverfield - Shane Mauss
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: 10 CLOVERFIELD LANE, CROUCHING TIGER 2: HIDDEN BULLSHIT, CHRIS NOLAN FILMS* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest Shane Mauss. Chris and Graham both liked 10 Cloverfield. Shane and Chris found the Crouching Tiger sequel to be silly. Shane talks about his favorite Christopher Nolan films. Many Oscar films on DVD and some weird choices in theaters. This is the episode to listen too if John Goodman is your dad in a bunker.

episodes.title: Ep 310 Zootopia - Greg Proops
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: RACE, WHISKEY TANGO FOXTROT, ZOOTOPIA, WHAT HAPPENED, MISS SIMONE? DEADPOOL* Chris and Graham welcome back Greg Proops! Graham thought Race was a so-so biopic. Chris and Graham spilt on Tina Fey's new film. Chris and his family liked Zootopia. Greg like Nina Simone doc but wanted a little more. Greg talks about going to Turner Classic Movie Fest. Jackie Kashian gives us a SpareMin on Deadpool. Odd choices for DVD and in theaters. This ep will make you want to bleed in the Balkins!

episodes.title: Ep 309 Oscar wrap-up - Tawan Bazemore
episodes.summary: The 88th Oscar Awards are over so Chris and Graham are going to break it down. They have colorist Tawan Bazemore on to discuss how Chris Rock handled the race issue, upsets and more.  Also Tawan explains what the color correction process is in post production of filmmaking and specifically what he has done for Ear Buds.  This ep will make you want to fight a bear.

episodes.title: Ep 308 Oscar Predictions - Doug Benson
episodes.summary: Chris and Graham welcome back Doug Benson to go over all the Oscar nominations and predict who will win. Get your Oscar pools ready cause the best info is here! (we hope)

episodes.title: Ep 307 - Deadpool - Oscar Nunez
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: DEADPOOL, THE REVENANT, THE 33* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest from The Office, Oscar Nunez. Graham and Chris really liked Deadpool. Oscar liked the graphic novel and was happy with the casting. Oscar was blown away by The Revenant. Oscar also talks about filming the new Baywatch movie and working in a mine on The 33. Good DVDs this week and maybe some sleeper hits in theaters. You will want to ride a train with Ernest Borgnine after listening to this ep.

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 42 Hail Caesar
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM DISCUSSED, INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham welcome back Paul Goebel to talk about Hail Caesar. Listen to Paul and Chris convince Graham to like the movie more.  Also some good Coen brothers film talk. So many bonus eps!!!

episodes.title: Ep 306 - Room - Gareth Reynolds
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: ROOM, HAIL CAESAR, CAROL* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest, Gareth Reynolds into the nerd Hunger Games box. Graham and Chris both think Room is excellent and worthy of all the awards. Gareth liked the acting in Carol. All three liked the fun of Hail Caesar. Gareth talks about some of his favorite documentaries. So-so DVDs and a big Deadpool question mark in theaters. This ep will make you want to have some beers with your wife.

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 41 Kung Fu Panda 3
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT!!! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED, INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham welcome back Chris' daughter Isabella into her dad's garage. They talk about why they liked the film and their favorite Chinese food. This episode will make you want to fight an evil cow.

episodes.title: Ep 305 - Brooklyn - Marc Guggenheim
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: BROOKLYN, KUNG FU PANDA 3, BRIDGE OF SPIES* Chris and Graham welcome back Marc Guggenheim. Marc talks about writing for Arrow and DC Legends of Tomorrow. Graham and Chris both disliked Brooklyn. All three liked Kung Fu Panda 3 as well as Marc and Chris' kids. Marc talks about the current state and future of comic book movies. A lot of questions for new DVDs. Caesar and some typical February releases. This ep will make you bite the hand that feeds you.

episodes.title: Ep 304 - Danish Girl - Alison Rosen
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: THE DANISH GIRL, ANOMOLISA, BIG SHORT, OBVIOUS CHILD* Chris and Graham welcome back podcaster Alison Rosen. Graham is disappointed with Danish Girl and the Oscars. Chris was intrigued by Anomolisa. Alison found The Big Short to be informative. Alison also talks about her favorite rom-coms and some guilty pleasures. Two good DVDs and more reason to see films that should have been nominated in theaters this weekend. This ep will make you want to have puppet sex.

episodes.title: Ep 303 - Concussion - Kira Soltanovich
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: CONCUSSION, ATTACK ON TITAN, MAZE RUNNER SCORCH TRIALS, ROAD CHIP* Chris and Graham welcome back Kira Soltanovich to the nerd box. Graham thought Concussion should have received some Oscar Nominations. Chris asks you to do homework before watching Attack On Titan. Kira gave Alvin and the Chipmunks: Road Chip a big thumbs up for sleeping. Chris couldn't understand Scorch Trials. Some good and some dumb on DVD. Also perfect time to watch all the Oscar films as new releases are useless. This is the Woodpecker of all episodes!

episodes.title: Ep 302 The Revenant - Matt Belknap
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: THE BIG SHORT, THE HATEFUL EIGHT, THE REVENANT, STAR WARS* Chris and Graham welcome back Matt Belknap into the weight bench office. Graham and Matt both like Big Short but can't remember what Margot Robbie said. Chris did not like Hateful Eight as much as Graham. The Reverent made Graham want to kill a bear and sleep in it. More discussion about Star Wars and George Lucas feeling like a billionaire slave. Horrible DVDs and many reasons to find Golden Globe winners and future Oscar noms in theaters. This episode will make you want bird pizza!

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 40 - Star Wars: The Force Awakens
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM, INCLUDING ENDING, WILL BE DISCUSSED. PLEASE WATCH MOVIE FIRST* Chris and Graham welcome Dean Haglund in town from Sydney to do even more in-depth discussion about the new Star Wars film. Don't be a nerf herder, just listen.

episodes.title: Ep 301 Christmas/Year End Thank You
episodes.summary: Chris and Graham thank everyone who helped make CFN have a great 2015. We couldn't have done all the cool things we did without all of you. Happy Holidays to the best fans in the world!! See you in 2016 :)

episodes.title: EP 300 Star Wars Force Awakens Spoiler-Live from Australia
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT!! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham do a Star Wars: Force Awakens Spoiler episode mash-up with Steele Wars podcast. Steele Saunders was kind enough to let the guys come to a midnight screening and then do a live podcast at Seamus O'Tooles Irish Pub in front of 250 people in Melbourne Australia! Yes Chris and Graham flew 15 hours to do the best spoiler epode ever! CJ Johnson and a long list of funny Aussie comics and Star Wars fans come on stage to talk about the movie they all just watched. SPECIAL GUEST GEORGE LUCAS!! This episode will make you travel the galaxy to find a long lost family member!

episodes.title: DVD Closet - Jackie Kashian
episodes.summary: *SPECIAL BONUS EP!  DVD CLOSET* Jackie Kashian brings all her favorite Holiday Themed DVDs. From Holiday Inn to Die Hard and everything in between. This bonus ep is a Christmas Miracle!!

episodes.title: Ep 299 - Krampus
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: KRAMPUS, TRUMBO, HAPPY VALLEY* Chris and Graham are both getting over colds but still had time to talk films. Chris liked Krampus but wanted just a little bit more. Graham thinks Trumbo is solid Oscar material. Happy Valley is a good doc that will make you mad. Marvel heavy DVDs and some good films in theaters this week. Episode 299 will make you write in your bathtub.

episodes.title: SPOILER EP 39 - HUNGER GAMES MJ Part 2
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT!! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham talk about the parts of this film (and franchise) they like and didn't.

episodes.title: Ep 298  Creed - Laura House
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: CREED, HUNGER GAMES, GOOD DINOSAUR, TRUMBO, SECRET IN THEIR EYES* Chris and Graham are caught in a love triangle with Laura House. Graham liked Creed. Chris and Graham liked Hunger Games but not the love triangle. Laura likes love triangle's even when society collapses. Chris found Good Dinosaur to be all over the place. Laura thinks Trumbo will be in the Oscar race. Graham was let down with Secret in Their Eyes. Ok DVDs but more solid films coming out in theaters. This ep is like a lady Taken. SAVE 10% ON EVERYTHING IN STORE WITH COUPON CODE "HOLIDAYWORKIT"

episodes.title: Ep 297 Rock N Roll Movies - Lord Carrett
episodes.summary: *THEMED EP: ROCK AND ROLL MOVIES* Chris and Graham welcome long time writer but first time guest Lord Carrett into their NYC hotel room. Lord talks about some of his favorite rock and roll films of all time.  This is the Spinal Tap of episodes.

episodes.title: Ep 296 Spotlight - Rob Cohen
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: ALL THINGS MUST PASS THE RISE AND FALL OF TOWER RECORDS, KNOCK KNOCK, SPOTLIGHT* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest, Rob Cohen. Rob talks about the Tower Records documentary and why he liked it.  Chris liked the first 45 minutes of Knock Knock. Graham found Spotlight to be a solid Oscar contender. Rob tells us about his documentary, Being Canadian. Chris is really excited about some DVDs. Good films coming out in theaters. This ep will make you start your very own Star Chamber!

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 38 The Martian - Keith and The Girl
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM WILL BE DISCUSSED INCLUDING ENDING* Chris and Graham travel to NYC to talk with Keith and The Girl about The Martian. Chris and Graham liked it but KATG well...not so much. Listen and learn.

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 37 - Spectre
episodes.summary: *SPOILER EP ALERT! KEY ELEMENTS OF FILM, INCLUDING ENDING, WILL BE DISCUSSED* Chris and Graham discuss why they liked Spectre and also understand why people didn't like it.  Listen and enjoy this ep shaken not stirred.

episodes.title: Ep 295 - Spectre - John Matta
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: SCOUTS GUIDE TO THE ZOMBIE APOCALPYSE, SPECTRE* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest and long time friend John Matta. Graham had fun watching Scouts Guide. All three enjoyed Spectre but felt like maybe 007 is done. John talks about his new book and working with Kurt Russell. Amy Schumer and Sherlock Holmes are on DVD which makes the slow weekend in theaters easier to take. This ep will make you want to clap at a trailer.

episodes.title: Ep 294 Bone Tomahawk
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: CLOUDS OF SILS MARIA, BONE TOMAHAWK* Chris and Graham are alone in the garage hatching plans to invade Belgium and talking movies. Graham found Clouds to be an ok indie film.  Chris wanted Bone Tomahawk to be better but still found parts of it entertaining. Chris had a blast at Halloween Horror Nights at Universal Studios. 2 of 3 good DVDs and 007 in back!! This ep will make you want to fly across the world to do a bar gig.

episodes.title: CFN Halloween/Shriekfest BONUS EP
episodes.summary: SOME HORROR FILM TALK POST HALLOWEEN BONUS EPISODE!  Chris and Graham talk about their favorite horror films and Chris interviews the founder of Shriekfest. So much horror film talk it will make you want to take a nap on your new mattress!!

episodes.title: Ep 293 - Steve Jobs - Tyler Smith and David Bax
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: STEVE JOBS, CRIMSON PEAK, BEASTS OF NO NATION, LAST WITCH HUNTER* Chris and Graham welcome first time guests Tyler Smith and David Bax. Tyler and David talk about their film podcast Battleship Pretension. David, Graham and Tyler liked Steve Jobs, but not the accents. Tyler thinks Jobs is best picture of the year. Chris enjoyed Crimson Peak even with it's shortcomings. Graham is glad Beasts of No Nation is out there informing people. Tyler saw Last Witch Hunter and can't remember it at all.  Not a great week for DVDs or in theaters. This ep will make you want to create a Sean Connery film with no plot!

episodes.title: Ep 292 - Bridge of Spies - Wayne Federman
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: BRIDGE OF SPIES, STEVE JOBS, GOOSEBUMPS, GREEN INFERNO* Chris and Graham welcome back Wayne Federman to talk films and Bones auditions. Graham liked Bridge of Spies and thinks it will be in the Oscar race. Wayne felt the same about Steve Jobs.  Chris and his family had fun at Goosebumps. Wayne was loving Green Inferno and how sensitive Graham is. Wayne talks about his new comedy album. Ok DVDs and maybe one good film in theaters. This episode will make you eat hippies.

episodes.title: Ep 291-The Martian-Frank Woodward and Jack Bennett
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: THE MARTIAN, SICARIO, PAN* Chris and Graham welcome back Frank Woodward and first time guest Jack Bennett.  Both guys are filmmakers and horror fans. Graham, Chris and Frank all liked The Martian. Graham is happy when Emily Blunt is a bad ass like in Sicario. Chris hated Pan. Frank and Jack talk about what new horror films are getting them excited. At least one good DVD and then a good weekend for counter programming. This ep will start a Mexican Eat Off.

episodes.title: Ep 290 - LA Podfest- Dave Foley, Doug Benson, Suzy Nakamura
episodes.summary: *RECORDED IN FRONT OF LIVE AUDIENCE AT 2015 AUDIBLE LA PODFEST* Chris and Graham do a Ear Buds Q and A with Doug Benson and editor Tina Imahara. Then Dave Foley and Suzy Nakamura join the show to talk about new show on ABC Dr. Ken and upcoming films! Some good, some bad and some in German.

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 36 - Everest
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY PLOT POINTS, INCLUDING ENDING, WILL BE DISCUSSED* Chris and Graham talk about why they split on this film and which food theater is the new king.

episodes.title: Ep 289 - Everest- Chris and Graham
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: EVEREST, PAWN SACRAFICE* Chris and Graham were too tired to book a guest so get ready! Chris did not like Everest but Graham enjoyed it from his comfortable food theater. Graham was a little disappointed by Pawn Sacrifice, but still has some good performances. The boys talk about how fun Podfest was. Some good DVDs this week. Finally good movies are back in theaters! This ep will make you climb a fake mountain while eating a salad.

episodes.title: Ep 288 - Black Mass - Shawn Merek
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: BLACK MASS, TRANSPORTER 3, MAD MAX ANTHOLOGY, EAR BUDS* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest and former CFN intern Shawn Merek. Shawn talks about his podcast, Worst Collection Ever. Graham liked the parts of Black Mass he wasn't sleeping through. Shawn was bored with Transporter. Chris was thrilled watching the original Mad Max on Blu Ray. All three talk about how fun LA Podfest was and seeing Ear Buds on the big screen. This ep will make you put someone in the trunk.

episodes.title: Ep 287 Sharknado 3 - Erin Foley
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: SHARKNADO 3, THE MARTIAL ARTS KID, THE VISIT, WHITEY, BLOOD SUCKING BASTARDS* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest Erin Foley into the weight bench garage. Graham loved Sharknado 3 and seeing himself on the big screen in Martial Arts Kid. Erin was surprisngly entertained by The Visit. Chris loved the low budget fun of Blood Sucking Bastards. Graham recommends the Whitey Bulger doc. Erin talks about her favorite sports films. Good DVDs to choose from. Some Oscar films are creeping back into movie theaters. This ep is will give you a Boston accent.

episodes.title: Ep 286 - American Ultra - Owen Benjamin
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: AMERICAN ULTRA, BATMAN VS ROBIN, Z FOR ZACHARIAH* Chris and Graham welcome first time guest, Owen Benjamin, into the Nerd garage! Graham liked American Ultra in his favorite theater. Chris had some small problems with Batman vs Robin but overall it was good.  Owen liked the acting in Z for Zachariah. Owen talks about his favorite sci-fi films and why he likes them.  Two good DVDs which will help get you through another lame weedend in theaters. This ep will make you love Funny Girl.

episodes.title: Ep 285 Cult Films - Adam Rifkin
episodes.summary: BONUS EP!! Filmmaker Adam Rifkin comes into the Nerd HQ to discuss cult films.  Adam tells us what films influnced him and why. Also Adam talks about his new films Shooting the Warwicks and Director's Cut.  This ep will make you want to become a small soldier and fight in an army of darkness.

episodes.title: Ep 284 End of Tour - Greg Fitzsimmons
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: MISSION IMPOSSIBLE, END OF THE TOUR, STUDIO GHIBLI RETROSPECTIVE, WES CRAVEN FILMS, TRAINWRECK* Chris and Graham welcome back Greg Fitzsimmons to the Nerd Sweat Lodge. Greg liked the action of Mission Impossible. Graham liked End of the Tour while sleeping on a couch.  Chris saw two Studio Ghibli films on the big screen. All three talk about some of thier favoirte Wes Craven films. Greg was very happy with Trainwreck. Some fury in DVDs and interesting films in theaters.  This ep will make you want to have sex on a surf board!

episodes.title: Ep 283 Mission Impossible - Stefanie Wilder-Taylor
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: THE GIFT, MAN FROM UNCLE, MISSION IMPOSSIBLE* Chris and Graham welcome back Stefanie Wilder-Taylor. Stefanie and Graham both found some problems with The Gift even though it has good perfromances. Graham thought UNCLE was a borning bag of bad accents. Chris didn't care for Rogue Nation. Stefanie tells us what kids movies she liked this year.  One good DVD and two stupid ones. New releases are useless.  This ep will make you want to get a nice mid shoe.

episodes.title: Ep 282 Straight Outta Compton - Baron Vaughn
episodes.summary: *FILMS DISCUSSED: FANTASTIC FOUR, TRAINWRECK, LEGO BRICKUMENTARY, STRAIGHT OUTTA COMPTON, WYRMWOOD*  Chris and Graham welcome back Baron Vaughn. Graham was bored with Fantastic Four.  Chris found Brickumentary to be just ok. Baron and Graham both liked Straight Outta Compton.  Chris liked the low budget-ness of Wyrmwood. Graham and Baron both liked Trainwreck. Baron talks about his new podcast with Leonard Maltin. Bizare DVD choice and three films in theaters that don't look good. This ep will make you want more Steve Guttenberg in your diet!

episodes.title: Ep 281 Gilbert Gottfried
episodes.summary: *THEMED EPISODE: CLASSIC COMEDIES* Chris and Graham welcome frist time guest Gilbert Gottfried. Gilbert talks about why he loves classic comedy films. Also Gilbert discusses his new Amazing Colassal Podcast.  Fun film talk from a comedy legend!

episodes.title: Spoiler Ep 35 - Ant Man
episodes.summary: *SPOILER ALERT! KEY PLOT POINTS OF FILM, INCLUDING ENDING WILL BE DISCUSSED* Chris and Graham welcome Andy Wood to discuss Ant Man.  Chris and Andy seemed to like it better than Graham did!  Listen and decide for yourself!
